intro: Corispermum afghanicum, commonly known as Afghan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers and has succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert environments. Corispermum afghanicum is noted for its resilience to drought and high temperatures.
